low: Rain can potentially harm hardware device, take necessary precautions
Light rain adds extra dirt and nutrients from nearby areas to water
Medium winds make small waves, briefly lowering oxygen in surface water
Slow temperature changes mildly affect fish energy and movement
Light clouds block sunlight gently, slowing algae food production
Small weather shifts may cause timing changes in breeding activity
high: Severe weather breaks equipment and causes major water problems with losses
Extreme storms bring huge amounts mud and dirt, ruining water badly
Strong winds physically hurt fish and damage pond structures severely
Very heavy rain causes nutrient overload, growing dangerous algae
Flooding carries harmful chemicals and sickness-causing agents, spreading disease
Sudden severe weather changes shock fish, causing deaths and harvest losses
